alert.note: Alert for Anchorage; Matanuska Valley; Susitna Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 27 at 4:32AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...RAIN CHANGING TO SNOW TODAY WITH GUSTY SOUTHERLY WINDS... Colder air will move up Cook Inlet and the Western Kenai Peninsula to Anchorage and the Mat-Su, leading to a transition from rain to snow as we head through the day. There will be some minor wet snow accumulation for areas at sea level, with higher amounts in the mountains as well as over the northern to western Susitna Valley. Expect a brief period of moderate snow with low visibilities as the snow moves through. Gusty southerly winds will accompany the colder air. The strongest winds will be along Kachemak Bay and Cook Inlet on up into Anchorage, with gusts of 35 to 45 mph along Kachemak Bay and 25 to 35 for the remainder of the area. Temperatures will drop below freezing tonight causing any water and slush along roadways to freeze up.

area.areaDesc: Anchorage; Matanuska Valley; Susitna Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula
